sen.j: 入唐求法巡礼行記（にっとうぐほうじゅんれいこうき）とは、9世紀の日本人僧で、最後の遣唐使（承和）における入唐請益僧である円仁（794年‐864年）の旅行記である。
sen.e: The Record of a Pilgrimage to China in Search of the Law is a travel diary written by Ennin (794-864), a Japanese monk who lived in the 9th century and was approved to join the last mission to Tang China in the Jowa era.

sen.e: The earliest manuscript is the one once belonging to To-ji Temple, Kanchi'in, which was hand-copied in 1291 by Ken'in of Choraku-ji Temple in Gion, Kyoto, at the age of 72.

sen.j: 70歳を越えた老僧が老眼鏡も無い時代に苦労して書写した写本であり、解読に困難な文字が少なくない。
sen.e: A monk more than 70 years-old labored to make this manuscript in an age without reading glasses, so there are quite a few letters hard to decipher.

sen.j: その記述内容は、ちょうど遭遇してしまった、武宗 (唐)による会昌の廃仏（三武一宗の廃仏の3番目）の状況を記録した同時代史料として注目される。
sen.e: The description has received attention as a contemporary historical source recording the circumstances of the persecution of Buddhists in the Huichang era by Emperor Wuzong of Tang (the third of four emperors in a row who had persecuted Buddhism), which he was confronted with by chance.

sen.cmt: Added "in the diary" to "descriptions" to make it a bit clearer. The last line is a bit confusing, so I changed it to "a situation the author encountered by chance"

sen.j: 正史には見られない、9世紀の中国の社会・風習についての記述も多く、唐の歴史研究をする上での貴重な史料として高く評価される。
sen.e: Because of the many descriptions of Chinese society and customs in the 9th century that do not appear in official histories, it is rated as a highly valuable historical source for the study of Tang history.

sen.j: 中国や日本では、玄奘（602年‐664年）の『大唐西域記』やマルコ・ポーロ（1254年 - 1324年）の『東方見聞録』以上の価値があると評価する歴史学者もいる。
sen.e: In China and Japan, some historians consider it more valuable than "The Great Tang Dynasty Record of the Western Regions" (Da Tang Xiyu ji) written by Xuanzang (602-664) or "The million: Travels of Marco Polo" (Il millione) written by Marco Polo(1254-1324).
sen.cmt: 玄奘 名前の表記の仕方は2種類ありましたが、現代中国の表記法に従い、書名も複数の翻訳がある中で、比較的新しい書籍から取りました。
sen.e: In China and Japan, some historians consider it more valuable than Da Tang Xiyu ji (The Great Tang Dynasty Record of the Western Regions) written by Xuanzang (602-664) or The Travels of Marco Polo written by Marco Polo(1254-1324).
sen.cmt: Removed quotation marks from the title. I believe The Million is a nickname for. Polo's work, not an actual part of the title itself, so I cut it. Used original Chinese title.

sen.j: 1955年には、駐日大使でもあったエドウィン・O・ライシャワーが英訳して紹介し、各国語に翻訳されて広く知られる所となる。
sen.e: In 1955, it was translated into English and introduced by Edwin O. Reischauer, who was U.S. Ambassador to Japan, and then translated into several other languages and became widely known.
sen.cmt: 本文によると「駐日大使でもあった」エドウィン・O・ライシャワーによる英訳は1955年ですが、確認したところ彼の駐日大使の任期は1961-66年でした。ひとまず原文通りに訳してはおりますが、同時代であることを想起させる「でもあった」という表現は不適切ではないでしょうか。
sen.e: In 1955, it was translated into English and introduced by U.S. Ambassador to Japan Edwin O. Reischauer, and after being translated into several other languages it became widely known.
sen.cmt: Cut "who was" and added the "U.S. Ambassador to Japan" before his name. Replaced "then" with "after being" and "and" with "it" to make the sentence read more naturally. Also, I feel we need to know what it was "introduced" to. Literally critics? The west at large?
sen.e: In 1955, it was translated into English and introduced by U.S. Ambassador to Japan Edwin O. Reischauer, and after being translated into several other languages it became widely known.
